title: Data list
text: International Tuition Fees Public Post-Secondary Institutions Economic Development Region Sourced British Columbia Data Catalogue, Excel file contains “Annual Academic Arts Program tuition fees full-time international students public post-secondary institutions Economic Development Region (EDR) institution. Academic Years 2011/12 2021/22.” Original file name: “tui2_international_tuition_fees_at_public_post_secondary_institutions_by_economic_development_r.xlsx” https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/international-tuition-fees--public-post-secondary-institutions--economic-development-region License: Open Government Licence - British Columbia

title: Data list
text: Statistics Canada made available anonymized Public-Use Microdata File (PUMF) Joint Canada/United States Survey Health, telephone survey conducted late 2002 early 2003. 8,688 respondents survey, 3,505 Canadians 5,183 Americans. PUMF fixed-width file named “JCUSH.txt”. line 552 columns length. webpage survey, including PUMF file, data dictionary, methodological notes, : https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/82m0022x/2003001/4069119-eng.htm License: Statistics Canada Open License Source: Statistics Canada, Joint Canada/United States Survey Health 2002-03, 2004. Reproduced distributed “” basis permission Statistics Canada.

title: Data list
text: penguins dataframe {palmerpenguins} dataset, different formats: comma-separated values penguins.csv SAS penguins.sas SPSS penguins.sav Stata penguins.dta
code: # code to create file readr::write_csv(palmerpenguins::penguins,                   here::here("penguins.csv")) # code to create file haven::write_sas(palmerpenguins::penguins,                   here::here("penguins.sas")) # code to create file haven::write_sav(palmerpenguins::penguins,                  here::here("penguins.sav")) # code to create file haven::write_dta(palmerpenguins::penguins,                  here::here("penguins.dta"))

title: Data list
text: fixed-width version {palmerpenguins} dataset 8 different variables, described table : fixed-width file created minimize white space. first four last two rows data look like : Note first row variable names. common fixed-width files.
code: readLines(dpjr::dpjr_data("penguins_fwf.txt"), n = 4) #> [1] "Adelie   Torgersen39.118.71813750male  2007" #> [2] "Adelie   Torgersen39.517.41863800female2007" #> [3] "Adelie   Torgersen40.318.01953250female2007" #> [4] "Adelie   Torgersen                     2007" tail(readLines(dpjr::dpjr_data("penguins_fwf.txt")), 2) #> [1] "ChinstrapDream    50.819.02104100male  2009" #> [2] "ChinstrapDream    50.218.71983775female2009" # code to create fwf file gdata::write.fwf(penguins_df, file = "penguins_fwf.txt",                  width = c(                    9,   # species                    9,   # island                    4,   # bill_length_mm                    4,   # bill_depth_mm                    3,   # flipper_length_mm                    4,   # body_mass_g                    6,   # sex                    4    # year                  ),                  sep = "",                  colname = FALSE)

title: Data list
text: fixed-width version {palmerpenguins} dataset, character strings associated values replaced numeric values. 8 different variables, described table : fixed-width file now less half width fixed-width file character values. first four last two rows data look like : Note first row variable names. common fixed-width files.

title: Data list
text: Excel version {palmerpenguins} dataset. file simulates circumstance data originally collected stored SPSS file, data collectors made data available Excel file. file contains two sheets, penguins_values, containing individual records, variables coded numerically. Note variables, “NA” used represent missing values. penguins_codebook contains output SPSS creates “DISPLAY DICTIONARY” syntax (“File > Display Data File Information > Working File” GUI menu sequence) SPSS used produce “dictionary” (codebook). information variables, including whether variable nominal scale.. License: Data available CC-0 license accordance Palmer Station LTER Data Policy LTER Data Access Policy Type data. -30-

title: Companion data for the book The Data Preparation Journey: Finding Your Way With R

title: Companion data for the book The Data Preparation Journey: Finding Your Way With R
text: convenience function dpjr_data() generates path raw data file, independent specific location user’s computer. example, read CSV file “mpg.csv”: alternative approach access files using system.file() function. Example:
code: df_mtcars <- read.csv(dpjr::dpjr_data("mpg.csv")) system.file("extdata", package = "dpjr")  system.file("extdata", "mpg.csv", package = "dpjr")  read.csv(system.file("extdata", "mpg.csv", package = "dpjr"))

title: Get file path to data files — dpjr_data
Get file path to data files — dpjr_data
text: function adapted `readxl::readxl_example()` `palmerpenguins::path_to_file`.

title: Get file path to data files — dpjr_data
text: path Name file quotes extension; example `"mpg.csv"` work. `NULL`, example files listed.

title: Get file path to data files — dpjr_data
code: # return a list of all the files in the package dpjr_data() #>  [1] "JCUSH.txt"                                #>  [2] "Video_SPSS.sav"                           #>  [3] "authors2_fwf.txt"                         #>  [4] "authors_count_fwf.txt"                    #>  [5] "authors_fwf.txt"                          #>  [6] "badpenguins.rds"                          #>  [7] "bcferries_2021.pdf"                       #>  [8] "census2021firstresultsenglandwales1.xlsx" #>  [9] "cr25"                                     #> [10] "date.xlsx"                                #> [11] "gapminder.csv"                            #> [12] "intl_tuition_fees_bc.xlsx"                #> [13] "lahman_2020.zip"                          #> [14] "lfs_canada_employment.rds"                #> [15] "mpg.csv"                                  #> [16] "mtcars.csv"                               #> [17] "noc_table.rds"                            #> [18] "nycflights13_sql.zip"                     #> [19] "penguin_summary.pdf"                      #> [20] "penguins.csv"                             #> [21] "penguins.dta"                             #> [22] "penguins.sas"                             #> [23] "penguins.sav"                             #> [24] "penguins_fwf.txt"                         #> [25] "penguins_fwf_code.txt"                    #> [26] "penguins_spss_output.xlsx"                #> [27] "seph_naics721_bc_sal.rds"                 #> [28] "us_bls_employment_2010-2020.csv"          # # return the full path of the named file dpjr_data("mpg.csv") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/dpjr/extdata/mpg.csv" # # return the head (first 6 rows) of the named file head(read.csv(dpjr_data("mpg.csv"))) #>   manufacturer model displ year cyl      trans drv cty hwy fl   class #> 1         audi    a4   1.8 1999   4   auto(l5)   f  18  29  p compact #> 2         audi    a4   1.8 1999   4 manual(m5)   f  21  29  p compact #> 3         audi    a4   2.0 2008   4 manual(m6)   f  20  31  p compact #> 4         audi    a4   2.0 2008   4   auto(av)   f  21  30  p compact #> 5         audi    a4   2.8 1999   6   auto(l5)   f  16  26  p compact #> 6         audi    a4   2.8 1999   6 manual(m5)   f  18  26  p compact
